001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils;
002
003import java.util.Arrays;
004import java.util.List;
005import java.util.Map;
006import java.util.stream.Collector;
007import java.util.stream.Collectors;
008import java.util.stream.Stream;
009
010import static org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils.CountingUtils.countingMap;
011
012/**
013 * Utility-class to work with strings, words and characters
014 * (some extension to JDK and {@link org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtils})
015 */
016public class CoreStringUtils {
017
018    /**
019     * Just a short-cut of JDK-invocation: <pre>{@code
020     *     Collectors.joining(System.lineSeparator())
021     * }</pre>
022     * @return the {@link Collector} that join the stream of strings with {@link System#lineSeparator()}
023     */
024    public static Collector<CharSequence, ?, String> multiLine() {
025        return Collectors.joining(System.lineSeparator());
026    }
027
028    /**
029     * @param str a string (eventually {@link CharSequence} to get the stream of chars
030     * @return the stream of chars as {@link Stream Stream&lt;Character&gt;}
031     */
032    public static Stream<Character> streamChars(CharSequence str) {
033        return str.chars().mapToObj(ch -> (char)ch);
034    }
035
036    /**
037     * Count the characters in passed string
038     *
039     * @param str a string to count the characters (as {@link CharSequence}
040     * @return a counting-map of characters in passed {@code str}
041     */
042    public static Map<Character, Integer> countingCharsMap(CharSequence str) {
043        return countingMap(streamChars(str));
044    }
045
046    /**
047     * Split the passed sentence on alphanumeric words
048     *
049     * @param sentence a string to sp[lit
050     * @return a {@link Stream Stream&lt;String&gt;} of alphanumeric words
051     */
052    public static Stream<String> splitWords(String sentence) {
053        return Arrays.stream(sentence.split("\\W"))
054            .map(String::trim)
055            .filter(word -> !word.isEmpty());
056    }
057
058    /**
059     * Split the passed sentence on alphanumeric words
060     *
061     * @param sentence a string to sp[lit
062     * @return a {@link List List&lt;String&gt;} of alphanumeric words
063     */
064    public static List<String> splitWordsList(String sentence) {
065        return splitWords(sentence).collect(Collectors.toList());
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * The same as {@link Collectors#joining(CharSequence)} with empty delimiter,
070     * but the elements of string are concatenated in <b>reversed order</b>.
071     * <hr/>
072     * <u><i>Note:</i></u> Not use for large streams, because  {@link StringBuilder#insert(int, Object)}
073     * is much slower than {@link StringBuilder#append(Object)} when the length of buffer is very big.
074     *
075     * @return the result as {@link CharSequence} (no extra copy of the result!)
076     * @param <T> the type of input elements to the reduction operation
077     */
078    public static <T> Collector<T, ?, CharSequence> joiningReversed() {
079        return joiningReversed("");
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * The same as {@link Collectors#joining(CharSequence)},
084     * but the elements of string are concatenated in <b>reversed order</b>.
085     * <hr/>
086     * <u><i>Note:</i></u> Not use for large streams, because  {@link StringBuilder#insert(int, Object)}
087     * is much slower than {@link StringBuilder#append(Object)} when the length of buffer is very big.
088     *
089     * @return the result as {@link CharSequence} (no extra copy of the result!)
090     * @param <T> the type of input elements to the reduction operation
091     */
092    public static <T> Collector<T, ?, CharSequence> joiningReversed(String delimiter) {
093        return joiningReversed(delimiter, "", "");
094    }
095
096    /**
097     * The same as {@link Collectors#joining(CharSequence, CharSequence, CharSequence)},
098     * but the elements of string are concatenated in <b>reversed order</b>.
099     * <hr/>
100     * <u><i>Note:</i></u> Not use for large streams, because  {@link StringBuilder#insert(int, Object)}
101     * is much slower than {@link StringBuilder#append(Object)} when the length of buffer is very big.
102     *
103     * @return the result as {@link CharSequence} (no extra copy of the result!)
104     * @param <T> the type of input elements to the reduction operation
105     */
106    public static <T> Collector<T, ?, CharSequence> joiningReversed(String delimiter, String prefix, String suffix) {
107        return Collector.of(
108            StringBuilder::new,
109            (sb, value) -> {
110                if (!sb.isEmpty() && !delimiter.isEmpty()) {
111                    sb.insert(0, delimiter);
112                }
113                sb.insert(0, value);
114            },
115            (left, right) -> { // the combiner is required for parallel streams
116                right.append(delimiter).append(left); return right;
117            },
118            sb -> sb.insert(0, prefix).append(suffix)
119        );
120    }
121}
